1553322131.content:
Another day, another failure. To be honest she shouldn't have even felt as down as she did considering this was nothing new. After years of constant failings to remove her curse, Nyx should've been able to brush this latest one off.

Unfortunately that wasn't to be the case this time around. In the past it had been just her and there was nothing to really lose if she failed. But things were different now, times had changed. She had a husband, a daughter, and a kingdom.

Whereas in the past she had nothing, now she had everything. Now more than ever she had to break her curse, because if she didn't everyone around her would eventually grow old and die while she remained the same.

Time had no effect on her. She was ageless. She wanted to be able to grow old alongside her beloved and die with him, not remain in the world while his spirit moved on. Add to that she would have to bury her daughter too.

The youthful dark mage shook her head to banish the negative thoughts creeping up in the back of her mind. She wouldn't give in to despair. She would find a solution to this... she had to. It just wouldn't be tonight.

With that in mind the ravenette sighed. Maybe some rest would do her some good. Anything to take her mind off the dark thoughts plaguing her. She took a seat on her and her husband's shared bed and began to lie back.

Before she could dose off though, the sound of double doors creaked open. Entering was none other than her husband Corrin from a long day of dealing with advisors and his own family.

After the war everything had quieted down but become a lot more hectic at home, what with all the reconstruction and ascending the throne. He hardly got any free time these days. However it looks like he might've just got some if his smile was anything to go by.

"Still awake?" He asked before entering their private quarters.

"Indeed." Nyx replied as she met his gaze. He took a seat by the edge of the bed and took not of the magic tools on the floor. He frowned slightly but covered it quickly.

"So I take it you tried again today?"

"Yes." she sighed. "And before you ask, no, I failed again."

The snow-haired man did his best to give his wife a reassuring smile. "I know you'll eventually get it right if you just keep at it."

"I know." said the dark mage, although she didn't sound very convinced.

Corrin knew she was really feeling down now. Normally she was so calm and composed, but today was one of those rare days where her true feelings showed. He needed to do something to take her mind off things.

He looked down at her eternally youthful visage until an idea came to mind. Nyx didn't know what he was up to as she'd taken to looking up at the ceiling, but a sudden pleasurable sensation by her feet caught her attention.

Looking down she could see her husband gently giving her a massage. He certainly hadn't done that in a while. "What are you doing?" she asked.

"Taking your mind off things." he answered without missing a beat. "It has been some time since I could give you my undivided attention."

He gently squeezed and she felt a jolt run down her spine. That felt nice. "I guess it has been a fortnight hasn't it."

He nodded. "Indeed it has. Do you mind if I put your mind and body at ease?"

For the first time tonight the elder woman smiled. "Not at all."
1553322131.title: Nyx, the Dark Mage!
